intro: Lippia wrightii, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has aromatic leaves that release a pleasant scent when crushed, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Lippia wrightii is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. It is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
